title: How to View Snapchat Stories Without Being Friends

steps.title: Open Snapchat.
steps.content: Open Snapchat. The Snapchat app icon is a white ghost on a yellow background. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Swipe left to see the “Stories” page.
steps.content: Swipe left to see the “Stories” page. [2] X Research source This page lets you look through Stories your friends have posted, Stories you have subscribed to, and new Stories from publishers, creators, and more in the “Discover” section. [3] X Research source “Stories” can also be opened by tapping the icon with two silhouettes towards the bottom right of the screen. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Scroll through the “Discover” section and look for the desired account.
steps.content: Scroll through the “Discover” section and look for the desired account. There is a chance that you can find a specific person’s Story by looking through the “Discover” section. However, it is important to note that a person will only show up in this section if they have a Public Profile with their Stories set to appear publicly. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Open Snapchat.
steps.content: Open Snapchat. The Snapchat app icon is a white ghost on a yellow background.

steps.title: Bring up Snap Map.
steps.content: Bring up Snap Map. [6] X Research source Tap the location marker icon in the bottom left of the screen to bring up your Snap Map.

steps.title: Zoom in on a specific location.
steps.content: Zoom in on a specific location. Assuming you know the location of the person whose Snaps you would like to see, zoom in on that location on the map by placing two fingers close together on the screen, then pulling them apart. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Tap colorful hotspots near that location to look through Snaps.
steps.content: Tap colorful hotspots near that location to look through Snaps. Hotspots ranging in color from blue to red will appear on the map where people have added Snaps. Look through the Snaps in a specific area to see if a person has publicly added a Snap to Snap Map. [8] X Research source
